thread.title: Fallen Eagle Cousins facing fresh charges
thread.title_full: Fallen Eagle Cousins facing fresh charges

title: Fallen Eagle Cousins facing fresh charges
text:
Fallen AFL star Ben Cousins facing fresh charges February 24, 2017 1:36pm Source: AAP FALLEN AFL premiership player Ben Cousins is facing fresh charges related to drugs and family violence. 
Search warrants were issued at residences in the Perth suburbs of Melville and Bicton overnight, and Cousins was arrested when he arrived in a car at the Melville home. Former West Coast Eagles player Ben Cousins is facing fresh charges. AAP Image/Richard Wainwright Source: AAP Cousins outside court in December. AAP Image/Richard Wainwright Source: AAP 
Cousins has been charged with seven counts of breaching a violence restraining order, aggravated stalking, and possessing a prohibited drug and smoking utensil. 
The AFL made an unprecedented pledge to fund a drug rehabilitation program for Cousins after the Herald Sun revealed he was “living out of a backpack” in December last year. 
AFL chief executive Gillon McLachlan told Cousins’ father at the time that the AFL would help pay for an anti-drug program or rehab facility to get the 38-year-old out of his downward spiral. Cousins leaving court last November. Picture: Ian Munro/The West Australian Source: Supplied Cousins after another court appearance last year. Picture: Bohdan Warchomij Source: Supplied Cousins after winning his Brownlow in 2005. Source: Supplied A young Ben Cousins. Source: Herald Sun Cousins after the Eagles 2006 premiership win. Source: Herald Sun Cousins finished his career at Richmond. Photo: Scott Barbour/Getty Images Source: Supplied 
The AFL deregistered Cousins for bringing the game into disrepute in 2007 before he was allowed to return to the game in a two-year stint at Richmond. 
Brownlow medallist Cousins played 270 games and claimed the game’s highest individual honour in 2005. View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
